Test Name: Analytical Phase Protocol for Identifying Parasites in Samples Other Than Blood or Stool
Specimen Type: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), urine, sputum, and tissue biopsies
Purpose: To detect, identify, and report parasites in non-blood and non-stool specimens for diagnostic purposes.
Container: Sterile tubes or containers appropriate to the specimen (e.g., sterile tube for CSF; sterile container for urine, sputum, or tissue biopsy with saline).
Equipment: Microscopes with brightfield/darkfield/phase-contrast, sterile slides and coverslips, centrifuge, pipettes, staining reagents (Giemsa, Trichrome, Lugolâ€™s iodine), forceps, scalpels
